text:
Biologist with a Master’s degree in Natural Sciences, with a strong interest in data analysis and the use of digital tools to investigate and understand complex biological systems. My background combines scientific research with data-driven problem solving, enabling me to work confidently with diverse datasets. I apply analytical thinking, data visualisation, and computational approaches to derive meaningful insights across academic, health-related, and applied data contexts.

Scientific Researcher Data Analyst and Scientist

Biologist with a Master’s degree in Natural Sciences, with a strong interest in data analysis and the use of digital tools to investigate and understand complex biological systems. My background combines scientific research with data-driven problem solving, enabling me to work confidently with diverse datasets. I apply analytical thinking, data visualisation, and computational approaches to derive meaningful insights across academic, health-related, and applied data contexts.

Scientific Researcher Data Analyst and Scientist

Academic Background

Master of Science (MSc) in Natural Sciences
Universidad del Rosario, Bogotá, Colombia
Bachelor of Science (BSc) in Biology
Universidad del Rosario, Bogotá, Colombia





Scientific Research

Professional Profile
Biologist with a Master’s degree in Natural Sciences, with a strong international outlook on scientific research. My work focuses on microbial ecology, host–microbe interactions, and the role of microbiomes in public and environmental health. I have conducted research involving genomic surveillance of emerging pathogens and the analysis of complex microbial communities using high-throughput sequencing technologies such as Illumina and Oxford Nanopore. My approach combines molecular biology, computational metagenomics, and bioinformatic pipelines to explore microbial diversity, transmission patterns, and ecological dynamics.
PDF Scientific CV


Research and Work Experience
Research Assistant – GIMUR / CIMBIUR
Universidad del Rosario (2021–2024)

Participated in projects on genomic surveillance of emerging pathogens, including SARS-CoV-2 and Monkeypox virus.
Characterized the microbial ecology of various biological systems using next-generation sequencing (NGS).
Conducted molecular and bioinformatic analyses on different microbes using Sanger, Illumina or Oxford Nanopore Technologies (ONT)

Research Assistant – GIMUR / CIMBIUR
University of Oslo (2024)



Research Interests

Microbial ecology and evolution
Computational Metagenomics
Epidemiology and zoonotic diseases
Data analytics in life sciences






Data Analysis and Science

Professional Profile
Data analyst and scientist with a background in life sciences, focused on transforming raw data into actionable insights. I apply statistical methods and data visualisation tools, such as Python, R, Excel, and Power BI, to uncover patterns, build dashboards, and communicate results effectively. I aim to develop data-driven solutions that inform decisions and add value across diverse topics.

PDF Data analyst CV 



Work Experience
Freelancer (Data Analyst and Scientist)
Universidad del Rosario (2022 - Present)
Research Assistant – GIMUR / CIMBIUR
Universidad del Rosario (2021–2024)



Courses and Certificates

Fundamentals of Artificial Intelligence
CoderHouse, Argentina
Data Analytics
CoderHouse, Argentina


  
    
      Professional Portfolio
    
    
      Data Analysis Projects

Here you will find a collection of data analysis projects that showcase the application of statistical and computational tools to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets. These projects span topics ranging from public health to exploratory business analytics, and highlight techniques such as data cleaning, visualisation, and dashboard development. Each project is designed to communicate findings clearly and effectively, using tools like Excel, Python, R, and Power BI.




This project features an interactive dashboard designed to explore the geographic, demographic, and clinical patterns of COVID-19 cases in Colombia between 2023 and 2024. The dashboard enables users to visualise the distribution and evolution of confirmed cases, recoveries, and deaths across departments and municipalities, as well as by age group, sex, ethnic background, and patient status (recovered, active, deceased).



Analyse the spatial and temporal trends of COVID-19 cases, recoveries, and deaths across geographic (departments and municipalities), demographic (age, sex, ethnic group), and clinical (infection type, patient status) dimensions
Calculate key performance indicators (KPIs), such as the percentage of recoveries, active cases, and mortality rate
